t: Proverbs 5
Avoid Seduction
My*pn son, pay attention to my wisdom; listen*ln closely to my understanding
so*ln that you may maintain discretion and*ln your lips safeguard knowledge.
Though*ln the lips of the forbidden woman drip honey and*ln her words are smoother than oil,
in*ln the end she’s as bitter as wormwood and*ln as sharp as a double-edged sword.
Her*ln feet go down to death; her*ln steps head straight for Sheol.
She*ln doesn’t consider the path of life; she*ln doesn’t know that her ways are unstable.
So*pn now, sons, listen to me, and*ln don’t turn away from the words from my mouth.
Keep*ln your way far from her. Don’t*ln go near the door of her house.
Otherwise,*ln you will give up your vitality to others and*ln your years to someone cruel;
strangers*ln will drain your resources, and*ln your hard-earned pay will end up in a foreigner’s house.
At*ln the end of your life, you will lament when*ln your physical body has been consumed,
and*ln you will say, “How I hated discipline, and*ln how my heart despised correction.
I*ln didn’t obey my teachers or*ln listen closely to my instructors.
I*ln am on the verge of complete ruin before*ln the entire community.”
Enjoy Marriage
Drink*pn water from your own cistern, water*ln flowing from your own well.
Should*ln your springs flow in the streets, streams*ln in the public squares?
They*ln should be for you alone and*ln not for you to share with strangers.
Let*ln your fountain be blessed, and*ln take pleasure in the wife of your youth.
A*ln loving deer, a graceful doe— let*ln her breasts always satisfy you; be*ln lost in her love forever.
Why,*ln my son, would you lose yourself with*ln a forbidden woman or*ln embrace a wayward woman?
For*ln a man’s ways are before the Lord’s*s eyes, and*ln he considers all his paths.
A*ln wicked man’s iniquities will trap him; he*ln will become tangled in the ropes of his own sin.
He*ln will die because there is no discipline, and*ln be lost because of his great stupidity.
